=You are a helpful assistant.

parameters.name: records_by_date_and_or_status

workflowId.cachedResultName: Template | Your first AI Data Analyst

parameters.description: Use this tool to get records filtered by date. You can also filter by status at the same time, if you want.

value.status: ={{ $fromAI("status", "Status of the transaction. Can be Completed, Refund or Error. Leave empty if you don't need this now.", "string") }}

parameters.content:
To send all the items back to the AI, we need to finish with everything aggregated into one single item.

Otherwise it will respond with one item at a time, and the AI will only get the first item that arrives.

This node sends a custom HTTP Request to the Google Sheets API.

Filtering by date range in the Google Sheets API is very complicated.

This node solves that problem.

But doing the same in a database is much simpler. A tool could do it without needing a sub-workflow.

The output from this complex request is also messy.

So we use some code generated by ChatGPT to transform the data into JSON objects.

parameters.name: tq
parameters.value: =SELECT * WHERE A >= DATE "{{ $json.start_date }}" AND A <= DATE "{{ $json.end_date }}"

parameters.toolDescription:
Find transactions by product.
Our products are:
- Widget A
- Widget B
- Widget C
- Widget D
Only use this as last resort, because it will pull all data at once.

parameters.content:
## Some questions to try
There's a red button on this page that you can click to chat with the AI.

Try asking it these questions:

- How many refunds in January and what was the amount refunded?

- How many successful sales did we have in January 2025 and what was the final income of those?

- What is the most frequent reason for refunds?

## Copy this Sheets file to your Google Drive
https://docs.google.com/spreadsheets/d/18A4d7KYrk8-uEMbu7shoQe_UIzmbTLV1FMN43bjA7qc/edit?gid=0#gid=0

### ðŸ‘ˆ
The Calculator is a tool that allows an agent to run mathematical calculations.

### How to connect to Google Sheets?
To connect your n8n to your Google Sheets you're gonna need Google OAuth credentials

See documentation **[here](https://docs.n8n.io/integrations/builtin/credentials/google/oauth-single-service/)**

## ðŸ‘†
You can use many models here, including the free Google Gemini options.

Make sure to test it thoroughly. Some models are better for data analysis.

## ðŸ‘†
This is a short term memory. It will remember the 5 previous interactions during the chat

The **AI Tools Agent** has access to all the tools at the same time. It uses the name and description to decide when to use each tool.

Notice I'm using `$fromAI` function in all of them.

See documentations **[here](https://docs.n8n.io/advanced-ai/examples/using-the-fromai-function/)**

## ðŸ‘ˆ This is a special tool
It is used to call another workflow.
This concept is called sub-workflow.

See documentation [here](https://docs.n8n.io/flow-logic/subworkflows/).

Instead of running a completely separate workflow, we are calling the one below.

It's contained in the same workflow, but we are using the trigger to define it will run only when called by this tool.

# Sub-workflow
The AI can call this sub-workflow anytime,
by using the **Records by date** tool.

The sub-workflow automatically return
 the result of the last executed node to the AI.

values.lookupValue: ={{ $fromAI("transaction_status", "Transaction status can be Refund, Completed or Error", "string") }}
